title: "poisson"
format: html

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```


```{r}
# Create every combination of x-values and lambda values
pmf_data <- expand_grid(x = 0:10, lambda = c(0.5, 2, 5)) %>% 
  mutate(pmf = dpois(x, lambda)) # Compute PMF for each combination using dpois()

# Plot
pmf_plots <- ggplot(pmf_data, aes(x=x, y=pmf)) +
  geom_segment(aes(x=x, y= pmf, xend = x, yend = 0)) +
  geom_point(shape = 21, size = 1.5)+
  facet_wrap(~lambda, ncol = 1) + 
  labs(
    title = "PMFs for three Poisson random variables",
    x = "X",
    y = "Mass"
  ) 

pmf_plots
```
likelihood of each possible integer count of events
lambda = 0.5- 60% chance of 0 events, 30% chance of one event in time period
